column1.title: Wittgenstein - Tractatus logico-philosophicus
column1.description:
1 The world is everything that is the case.
1.1 The world is the totality of facts, not of things.
1.11 The world is determined by the facts, and by these being all the facts.

column1.title: Levels of Lucidity
column1.description: An exploration of different levels of lucidity, focusing on how our perception interacts with awareness in various states of consciousness.

column1.title: Bing - i observe
column1.description: A song capturing the essence of observation and introspection, expressing the relationship between experience and awareness.

column1.title: Michael Levin | Joscha Bach: Collective Intelligence

column2.title: Kant - The Critique of Pure Reason
column2.description:
In whatsoever mode, or by whatsoever means, our knowledge may relate to
objects, it is at least quite clear that the only manner in which it immediately relates
to them is by means of an intuition. To this as the indispensable groundwork, all
thought points.

column2.title: Stephen Wolfram - Observer Theory
column2.description: We call it perception. We call it measurement. We call it analysis. But in the end it’s about how we take in the world as it is, and derive from it the impression of it that we have in our minds.

column2.title: Goethe - Faust
column2.description:
Again you show yourselves,
you wavering Forms,
Revealed, as you once
were, to clouded vision.

column3.title: The Elephant and the Blind
column3.description:
Thomas Metzinger, one of the world's leading researchers on consciousness,
brings together more than 500 experiential reports to offer the world's first
comprehensive account of states of pure consciousness. Drawing on a large
psychometric study of meditators in 57 countries, Metzinger focuses on “pure
awareness” in meditation—the simplest form of experience there is—to illuminate
the most fundamental aspects of how consciousness, the brain, and illusions of
self all interact.

column3.title: An Essay on Consciousness
column3.description: An in-depth essay exploring the intricacies of consciousness, perception, and the human condition.

column3.title: Westworld: Season 1 (Music from the HBO Series)
column3.description: Music from the first season of HBO's Westworld, reflecting the interplay between artificial intelligence and human nature.
